name: Monserrate
description: An iconic mountain sanctuary offering panoramic views of the city and a historic church at the summit.

name: La Candelaria
description: A colonial neighborhood filled with museums, cafes, colorful architecture, and vibrant street art.

name: Gold Museum
description: One of the most important museums in Latin America, showcasing pre-Columbian gold artifacts and indigenous history.

name: Botanical Garden
description: A peaceful garden featuring native Colombian plants, greenhouses, and educational exhibits.

name: Bolívar Square
description: Bogotá’s main square surrounded by historic buildings including the Capitol, Cathedral, and City Hall.

name: National Museum
description: Colombia’s oldest museum, housing collections of art, history, and archaeology.

name: Colpatria Tower
description: The tallest building in Bogotá, featuring an observation deck and colorful nighttime light displays.

name: Usaquén Market
description: A lively artisan market offering handmade crafts, street food, and live music every weekend.
